lines.text: Red wine with fish. Well that should have told me something.
You may know the right wines, but you're the one on your knees. How does it feel old man?
[pointing a gun at Bond]
The first one won't kill you; not the second, not even the third... not till you crawl over here and you KISS MY FOOT!
I think my mouth is too big.
I think it's a very lovely mouth. It's just the right size - for me anyway!
Pardon me, do you have a match?
I use a lighter.
Better still.
Until they go wrong.
Exactly.
Klebb works for SPECTRE now. The girl doesn't know that.
Well, then I kill her?

Orders. That's only half of it, old man. Here's a roll of film. She'll have this in her handbag. And on you, they'll find this letter. It's from her. Planning to give the film to the press unless you marry her for helping you get the Lektor.
What film?
Taken in the bridal suite at your hotel. Something else the girl didn't know about. Or you.
[Sinister laugh]
That must have been a pretty sick collection of minds to dream up a plan like that.
Wish you'd see the headlines, "British agent murders beautiful Russian spy, then commits suicide."
Tell me, which lunatic asylum did they get you out of?

[angered]
Don't make it tougher on yourself!
[Grant slaps Bond across the face]
My orders are to kill you and deliver the Lektor. How I do it is my business. It'll be slow and painful.
[after James and Kerim bind and gag Benz, the Russian agent, James leaves while Kerim sits down to guard him]
I've had a particularly fascinating life. Would you like to hear about it?
[Benz tries to grunt "no."]
You would?
Horrible, horrible woman.
Yes, she had her kicks.

[trying on dresses]
I will wear this one in Picadilly.
You won't. They've just passed some new laws there.
Your clock, is it correct?
Always.
But of course.
[he walks away, checks his watch, then comes back]
Excuse me, you did say your clock was correct?
Russian clocks are always...
[the hidden tear-gas bomb explodes]

Siamese fighting fish, fascinating creatures. Brave but of the whole stupid. Yes they're stupid. Except for the occasional one such as we have here who lets the other two fight. While he waits. Waits until the survivor is so exhausted that he cannot defend himself, and then like SPECTRE... he strikes!
I find the parallel... amusing.
Our organization did not arrange for you to come over from the Russians just for amusement, Number 3.
[on seeing Kerim Bey's office in shambles]
Well... who won?
I had visitors. Limpet mine on the wall outside - timed to catch me at my desk. But by good fortune, I was relaxing on the settee for a few moments. The girl left in hysterics.
Found your technique too violent?
Where there's smoke, there's fire.

[in atypical self-effacement]
Suppose when she meets me in the flesh I-I don't come up to expectations?
Just see that you do.
Three men were found dead on the Orient Express train at Trieste. One of them was Grant. What have you got to say about that Number Five?
It was Klebb's choice. Her people failed.
It was your plan they followed implicitly.
Impossible. It was perfect.
Except for one thing, they were dealing with Bond.
Who is Bond compared with Kronsteen?

[Bond first meets Tatiana, who has crawled naked into his hotel bed]
You look surprised. I thought you were expecting me.
So, you're Tatiana Romanova.
My friends call me Tania.
Mine call me James Bond.
[Moneypenny, M, and other officials are listening to Bond's taped interview of Tatiana Romanova]
The mechanism is... Oh James, James... Will you make love to me all the time in England?
Day and night. Go on about the mechanism.
give a wolf a taste and then leave him hungry. My friend, she's got you dangling.
[last lines]

[removes ring and hands it to Bond]
Here you are. In case you ever need it again.
Oh, yes. All government property has to be accounted for. But as I said before, we won't always be working on the company's time. Will we?
No
[Tatiana kisses Bond passionately]
James, behave yourself. We are being filmed.
Oh, not again.
[Bond pulls a film reel from his pocket and unwinds it]
He was right, you know.
What is it?
I'll show you.
[Bond kisses Tatiana and throws the film away]
[first lines]

[after Grant kills a look-a-like Bond]
Exactly one minute, fifty-two seconds. That's excellent.

[aboard his yacht]
Bond is still alive and the Lektor is not yet in our possession. I've negotiated with the Russians for its return; we've agreed on a price. And S.P.E.C.T.R.E. ALWAYS delivers what it promises. Our entire organization survives upon the keeping of those promises...
[to Klebb]
We do NOT tolerate failure, Number Three. You know the penalty.

[numbly]
Yes, Number One.
if you fail...
[Morzeny kicks Kronsteen with a poisoned blade; he slowly collapses to the floor]
Twelve seconds. One of these days we must invent a faster-working venom. Number Three!
Yes, sir?
I do not wish to have to tell the Russians that there will be ANOTHER delay.
There will be no delay, Number One. There's still time.
[in Rose Klebb's Istanbul office]
Corporal, I have selected you for a most important assignment. It's purpose is to give false information to the enemy. If you complete it successfully, you will be promoted.
[referring to a picture of James Bond]
From now on, you will do anything he says.
And if I refuse?

[icily]
Then you will not leave this room alive.

[Thinks for a moment]
I will obey your orders.
Good. Now, these are your instructions. You'll report to me here. But the Consulate Security Man must not know that I am in Istanbul. This is classified *far* above his level.
I will say nothing to anyone.
If you do you will be *shot*!
[slams her cane hard against Tatiana's chair]

[flirtatiously]
Come, come, my dear.
[Starts rubbing her shoulders]
You're very fortunate to have been chosen for such a simple, delightful duty. A real labor of love, as they say.
[after shooting down a SPECTRE helicopter]
I'd say one of their aircraft is missing.
[When the two Gypsy girls are brought out to fight, Vavra addresses the tribe in the Romani Gypsy language]

[translating]
The women will fight until one of them is dead or surrenders. The winner will marry the man they both love, the loser will be cast out of the tribe, never to return. If both quit, the elders of the tribe will then decide who will marry the chief's son.
[speaking Romani, Vida lets out a long string of curses, glaring venomously at Zora]
She's saying that...
Yes, I think I got it without the subtitles.
Great sport, this!
What?
I said, it's great sport, this punting!
[Their punt passes another one beached behind some reeds, where James and Sylvia are making out]
I couldn't agree with him more.
Mmm, I may even give up golf for it.

[Longingly]
Ali Kerim Bey? Ali Kerim Bey? Ali Kerim Bey? You are not glad to see me this morning?

[Uninterestedly]
Overjoyed.
I-I no longer please you?
Be still! Ahh... Back to the salt mines.
You're one of the most beautiful girls I've ever seen.
Thank you, but I think my mouth is too big.
No, it's the right size... for me, that is.
Now, listen, just do as I say, will you?
Yes, James.
[James slaps Tatiana on the fanny]
But, there are some English customs - that are going to be changed.
But, of course, darling.
[Tatiana playfully laughs]
[refering to the irriating catchphrase Grant keeps repeating]
"Old man?" Is that what you chaps in SMERSH call each other?
SMERSH? I'm not with them.

[after a pause]
Of course... SPECTRE. So this wasn't a Russian show at all. You've been playing us off against each other, haven't you? So it was SPECTRE who killed that Bulgar agent in the St. Sophia mosque. Was that you?

[quitely]
Uh-huh.
Kerim and the other man?
Uh-huh.
And Nash?

Never mind. Oh, it's not that I don't mind talking. I get a kick out of watching you, the great James Bond, find out what a bloody fool he's been making of himself. We're pros, Mr. Bond. We sweated your little "may I borrow a match" recognition code out last month from one of your men in Tokyo before he died. Ever since your arrived in Istanbul, I've been keeping tabs on you. I've even been your guardian angel. Saved your life at the Gypsy camp.
[there is a short pause as Bond thinks back and remembers]
Oh, yes. I'm... much obliged.
[Punches Grant, who doesn't flinch, in the gut with brass knuckles]
He seems fit enough. Have him report to me in Istanbul in 24 hours.
Training is useful, but there is no substitute for experience.
we use live targets as well.
All of my key employees are my sons. Blood is the best security in this business.
How can a friend be in debt?
Is any of the opposition around?
Not in any condition to be worried about.
I hope Kronsteen's efforts as Director of Planning will continue to be as successful as his chess.
They will be.
How about a cigarette?
Not a chance.
I'll pay for it.
What with?
Fifty gold sovereigns.
She should have kept her mouth shut.
I hope you're not... disappointed.
I will tell you... in the morning.
We were keeping you alive until you could get us the Lektor.
So, you had me deliver it on a silver plate? That's brilliant. Go on, I'm fascinated.
Now that we've got it, you and the girl are expendable... from here onto Trieste.
The girl? Isn't she working for SPECTRE too?
No. She thinks she's doing it all for Mother Russia. She takes her orders from Colonel Klebb. And so do I.
Rosa Klebb? But Colonel Rosa Klebb is a Russian, head of operations for SMERSH.
was. Klebb works for SPECTRE now. The girl doesn't know that.
But why kill her?
Orders. That's only half of it, old man.
[Grant pulls out a roll of 8mm film and an envelope from his suit pocket]

Here's a roll of film. She'll have this in her handbag. And on you they'll find this letter. It's from her, threatening to give the film to the press unless you marry her for helping you steal the Lektor.

[confused]
What film?

[sneers]
Taken in the bridal suite at your hotel. Something else the girl didn't know about... or you.
[after tying up Benz with his own suit]
I'm not mad about his tailor, are you?
Number 3, is your section ready to carry out Kronsteen's directives?

Yes, Number 1. The operation will be organized according to Kronsteen's plan. I have selected a suitable girl from the Russian consulate in Istanbul. She's capable, cooperative, and her loyalty to the State is beyond question.
And you're absolutely sure she believes you're still head of operations for Soviet Intelligence?
It is most unlikely she would know I'm now working for SPECTRE. Moscow has kept my defection secret from everyone but a few members of the Presidium.
For your sake, I hope so.

SPECTRE would probably have the chance of a personal revenge for the killing of our operative - Dr. No - because the man the British will almost certainly use on a mission of this sort would be - their agent - James Bond.
Let his death be a particularly unpleasant and humiliating one.
I shall put my plan into operations straight away - and there will be *no* failure.
Welcome to SPECTRE Island!
This Grant is one of the best men we've ever had. A homicidal paranoid. Superb material.
Take off your jacket. Turn around. Hmm. You're a fine looking girl. Sit down. I see you trained for the ballet?
But, I grew an inch over the regulation height. And, so...
And then you have had - three lovers?
What is the purpose of such an intimate question?
You're *not* here to ask questions! You forget to whom you're speaking!
Sylvia, behave! We'll do this again some other time.
Do what? Last time you said that, you went off to Jamaica.
[Starts unbuttoning James' shirt]
I haven't seen you for six months!

[Playfully]
Once more into the breach, dear friends.
And one plane ticket, lucky man. I've never been to Istanbul.
You've never been to Istanbul? Where the moonlight on the Bosphorus is irresistible.
Maybe I should get you to take me there someday. I've tried everything else.
Darling, Moneypenny, you know I've never even looked at another woman.
Oh, really James?
Let me tell you the secret of the world...
[Interrupted by M]
My friend, if you really want my advice, you should spend a few pleasant days with us here in Istanbul and then - then go home.
Who can the Russians suspect, but the British. The cold war in Istanbul will not remain cold very much longer.
Take a look. You should remember him. This man kills for pleasure.

[Sarcastically]
Nice face.
It seems we've come on the wrong night. Two girls in love with the same man, threaten to kill each other. It must be settled the Gypsy way.

[Calling room service at this Istanbul hotel]
Hello. Breakfast for one at nine, please. Green figs. Yogurt. Coffee - very black. Thank you.

We are going to a highly interesting column over there, known for centuries at the Saint Sophia wishing column. Tens of thousands of people have wished here putting a right hand and middle finger in the hole.
Let's just say that Istanbul's a rough town.

[to Tatiana]
Keep your head down.
